purpose: Literature lemma prioritization for ν=4 proof

key_gap.name: tau_union_le_4
key_gap.why_needed: Induction gives τ ≤ τ(T_e ∪ T_f) + 2(ν-2). For ν=4: τ ≤ τ(T_e ∪ T_f) + 4. Need τ(T_e ∪ T_f) ≤ 4 to get τ ≤ 8.

counterexamples_blocking_strategies.name: pairwise_sharing_covered_by_e
counterexamples_blocking_strategies.desc: K4 shows 2 edges of e don't cover all pairwise-sharing
counterexamples_blocking_strategies.implication: Cannot use pure edge-of-e covering strategy

priority_critical.why_critical: Alternative attack: prove ν*(T_e ∪ T_f) ≤ 4 → get τ ≤ 8 via fractional
Fundamental inequality chain - enables fractional bounds → integer bounds

priority_high.why_high: For ν*=4: τ ≤ 7.18 < 8. Direct proof IF ν* = 4 for T_e ∪ T_f

priority_medium.why_medium: If T_e ∪ T_f induces 4-colorable, done. Unlikely in general.
Fallback bound: τ ≤ 11.5 for ν=4. Not tight but useful during development.

priority_low.why_low: Constraint on counterexamples, not proof technique
Constraint, blocked on treewidth definition anyway
Probabilistic - tells us where NOT to look, not how to prove

alternative_structural_approach.idea: Bridges to a single f might lie in K4 structure
